Text:
Ann George Atwater was a grassroots civil rights activist in Durham.  She dedicated her life advocating for equal housing, better schools, and anti-poverty initiatives.  #BlackHistoryMonth

Learn more➡️ https://t.co/e4BUkmtB2S

ICYMI: Last week, I spoke during the @HouseBudgetDems hearing on why Congress needs to #AbolishTheDebtLimit.

Watch my remarks here: https://t.co/XlGTU8DE4I

Ukraine has been a longstanding @House_Democracy partner country. We #StandwithUkraine in support of its democracy and territorial integrity, and strongly condemn Putin’s latest dangerous escalation in Eastern Ukraine.

Read my statement w/ @VernBuchanan: https://t.co/6HUp87qtcL

Henry M. “Mickey” Michaux, Jr. became Durham County’s first Black representative in the North Carolina General Assembly in 1972. He went to become the longest serving member of the NCGA, serving @DurhamCounty for more than four decades. #BlackHistoryMonth

Putin is trying to pull the wool over the world’s eyes, but the truth is plain to see — he is lying to justify an invasion of #Ukraine. His moves only strengthen our resolve to #StandwithUkraine. 

Thank you, @POTUS for swiftly imposing sanctions.

Benjamin S. Ruffin Jr. dedicated his life to increasing the quality of life for North Carolinians.  Born & raised in Durham, he served as the Chairman of the @DHAComm & was the first Black Chairman of the UNC Board of Governors. #BlackHistoryMonth

➡ https://t.co/QkctYR9w8T

Today, we celebrate 30 years of diplomatic relations with Moldova!

As co-chair of the bipartisan Congressional Moldova Caucus, I look forward to continuing to strengthen this important relationship & advance our shared interests.

See my full statement: https://t.co/Z1u0I1zXug

Pauli Murray was a fierce advocate for civil, women’s, & LGBTQ+ rights. The Durham native worked tirelessly, from fighting against racial segregation to co-founding @NationalNOW, to open doors for future generations. #BlackHistoryMonth

Learn more ➡ https://t.co/RdH50KbcnD

Ralph Campbell Jr. of Raleigh served as the 15th auditor of North Carolina. He was a political pioneer and the first African American to be elected to a statewide executive position in North Carolina. #BlackHistoryMonth

My DC & NC offices are currently accepting summer internship applications through March 4. 

Join my staff TODAY at 5:30 pm to learn more about the program and have your questions answered. 

Register here: https://t.co/y9r8Kq5OF7 https://t.co/kdLfYoyeLf

Today I met virtually with @SONorthCarolina leadership and athletes to discuss how Special Olympics opens doors, creates connections, and expands opportunities for people with intellectual disabilities. https://t.co/y6APfSu7aa

Chief Justice Henry Frye was the first African American elected to the NCGA, serving 6 terms in the House & 1 term in the Senate. Later, he became the first African American to serve on the NC Supreme Court. #BlackHistoryMonth

Learn more ➡ https://t.co/huIcbbw97M

My DC & NC offices are currently accepting summer internship applications through March 4.

Join my staff tomorrow, Thurs. Feb. 17 at 5:30 pm to learn more about the program and have your questions answered.

Register here: https://t.co/y9r8Kq5OF7 https://t.co/i1cCGDQoWq
We will long remember and benefit from his remarkable gifts – and his generosity in sharing them – as an interpreter and implementer of the values that matter most in our national life.
Walter was an accomplished constitutional scholar and legal practitioner whose life and advocacy faithfully mirrored the principles central to our democracy and the rule of law.
Lisa and I are shocked and saddened by Walter Dellinger’s death and want to express our condolences to his family, friends, and colleagues.

I am proud to receive a 100% rating from @HSLegFund’s 2021 Humane Scorecard for my consistent support for animal welfare!

https://t.co/mTQ79gRYmp

February is American Heart Month and a perfect time for us all to focus on our cardiovascular health!  With heart disease remaining the greatest health risk for Americans, it is important to create and stick with healthy habits.

Visit https://t.co/GZmbX5Hrfj to learn more. https://t.co/yOOzMteeCZ

4 years ago, 17 students & staff lost their lives during the tragic school shooting at @MSDHighSchool in Parkland, FL.

We must honor their memory & act now. As Vice Chair of @HouseGVP, I urge my Senate colleagues to join the House in passing common sense gun safety reforms.

Dr. John Hope Franklin was scholar of African American history & a civil rights icon. He served on the NAACP legal team that developed the landmark Brown v. Board of Education case. Later, he taught Legal History at Duke University. #BlackHistoryMonth

➡️ https://t.co/0IiciCPujB

On this day, 113 years ago, the @NAACP was founded with a mission to secure social justice and civil rights for African Americans.

Let us take a moment to recognize the tremendous work of the #NAACP in its fight to bring equality for all. #BlackHistoryMonth

Starting TODAY, select @IRS Taxpayer Assistance Centers will be open one Saturday per month from 9am to 4pm this spring to help taxpayers during the filing season – no appointments required.

Find a TAC near you: https://t.co/FYLHy4nEVi

For those who need in-person help this tax season, the @IRS is opening Taxpayer Assistance Centers (TACs) for “Special Saturdays” this spring.  The first day is this Saturday from 9am to 4pm. No appointments required!

Learn more and find a TAC near you:  https://t.co/FYLHy4nEVi

In the early 1900s, Durham's “Black Wall Street” served as a hub for Black entrepreneurship.

NC Mutual Life Insurance Company and Mechanics and Farmers Bank invested into the community propelling economic and social development. #BlackHistoryMonth 

➡️https://t.co/cD6mqVVhOx
Today, I met virtually with @HabitatWake and @orangehabitat representatives to discuss affordable housing and the critical federal programs that help make homeownership more accessible for all.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is #ElectrifyingAmerica. NC will receive over $16 million for Electric Vehicle (EV) charging stations.

This investment will help reduce harmful emissions with an expanded network of EV chargers to spur adoption of zero-emission cars. https://t.co/sutDpNbzCX

Dr. John R. Larkins devoted his life to public service, expanding rights and opportunities for Black North Carolinians.

To honor his legacy, the John R. Larkins Award is given to a NC state employee for their excellence in service. #BlackHistoryMonth

➡️https://t.co/SMLXibGI8S

REMINDER: My DC & NC offices are now accepting summer internship applications.

Join my staff next Thurs., Feb. 17, at 5:30 pm to learn more about the program and have your questions answered!

Register here: https://t.co/y9r8Kq5OF7 https://t.co/SYOjoluuww

This #BlackHistoryMonth I’m highlighting extraordinary NC-04 trailblazers.

Dr. James E. Shepard founded @NCCU, a pillar of the Durham community. Committed to improving access to quality education, he served as NCCU President until his death in 1947.

➡️https://t.co/v3Kkvf8Syi

Water treatment is infrastructure. I joined Karen Howard, @ChathamCountyNC Board of Commissioners Chair, on the banks of the Haw River to talk about how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will fund water access projects to support the community, growth, and jobs. https://t.co/M1E1pbm9WK

TODAY at 3pm:  Join me for an information session on the @FCC’s new Affordable Connectivity Program with special guest @JRosenworcelFCC.

Register here: https://t.co/AnvxD4DMgO https://t.co/vfqe0Wr0Qq

Congressional staff should have the right to collectively bargain, but current law prevents it. That’s why I joined @RepAndyLevin today to cosponsor a resolution making unions & the protections they provide a possibility for all hardworking congressional staff — including my own.

I am proud to cosponsor and vote for passage of the #GlobalRespectAct, which will help protect LGBTQI+ communities around the world from discrimination, persecution, and violence & ensure that human rights abusers are held accountable.

Today, I voted for a short-term funding bill that keeps the gov't open until 3/11, but we can't keep limping along this way.

Americans need a full year funding bill to expand critical programs & realize the full potential of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.

Watch my speech: https://t.co/8oC6pI22uo

I’m proud to vote for H.R. 3076, the Postal Service Reform Act. 

This legislation includes urgent @USPS reforms to support postal workers and ensure speedy, universal six-day service.

The expanded #ChildTaxCredit reduced child poverty for millions, but monthly payments expired last month, halting critical aid to children & their families.

Here's why we must renew the expanded Child Tax Credit: https://t.co/6jyP991S42

TOMORROW at 3pm: I’m hosting a virtual Affordable Connectivity Program information session with special guest @JRosenworcelFCC.

Join us to learn more about this new @FCC program and how it will help families afford internet service and devices.

Register: https://t.co/AnvxD4Vn8m https://t.co/ZcvPqKrGig

ICYMI: Friday, the NC Supreme Court ruled the new voting maps drawn by the NC General Assembly Republicans exhibit extreme partisan gerrymandering and violate our state constitution.

Read the reaction of the North Carolina Democratic delegation: https://t.co/lZH4U8Fe2I

In NC, 79% of workers don't receive paid family leave through their jobs -- forcing them to choose between work & family care.

Everyone deserves to be able to care for loved ones without worrying about financial security. It’s time to support #PaidLeaveforAll. #FMLA29 https://t.co/nQwgXdxd4G

On #TransitEquityDay, we honor trailblazer Rosa Parks’ birthday and her historic protest.   

Public transportation is an essential public service that should be accessible, affordable, and reliable for all riders and communities. https://t.co/k4zmXgkH2F

Interested in a summer internship in my office and want to learn more?  Join my staff on Thurs., Feb. 17 at 5:30 pm for a virtual information session to discuss the application process, internship experience, and answer your questions. 

Sign-up: https://t.co/jtOZ0g9jtX

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act is a comprehensive package focused on strategic investments to help us innovate & lead.

Two of my initiatives are included: 

1⃣ expansion of foreign language & international ed 
2⃣ @NSF workforce training at community colleges  

Hear why it's critical: https://t.co/8R5NAeYU6a

The @FCC new Affordable Connectivity Program will help families afford internet service and devices. 

Join me for an information session on this new program next Wed. Feb. 9 at 3:00 p.m., with special guest @JRosenworcelFCC! 

RSVP: https://t.co/AnvxD4DMgO https://t.co/KxhwjNPJ9X

Everyone should have clean water, but many communities need more resources to provide it.

I met with @Pittsboroncgov Mayor Cindy Perry to discuss how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law gives us an opportunity to remove PFAS ‘forever chemicals’ from our water. https://t.co/EvNZBSLPd2

Gun violence is a public health crisis.

This #GVSurvivorsWeek, we stand with survivors and remember those affected by this epidemic.

Survivors deserve action. #EndGunViolenceNow https://t.co/jNhJ8WqwCc

Every household can now order four free at-home COVID-19 tests, delivered to your door by @USPS. 

Help protect those around you in our fight to end this pandemic.

Order yours: https://t.co/z4MMq6wdBV.

Applications are now open for my paid summer internship program in the District and DC offices. 

Interns will gain first-hand knowledge of the legislative process and constituent services while developing their research skills. 

Apply here by March 4: https://t.co/EBGAcDxCtT https://t.co/354C4AESMH
Happy Lunar New Year! https://t.co/vmJAjYuFeB

On this day in 1960, four Black @ncatsuaggies students staged a sit-in at a segregated Woolworths lunch counter in Greensboro, NC, and refused to leave after being denied service. Their courage and strength inspired a nation. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/bzQS0R3U6F
Today is the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth! Together, we reflect on and celebrate Black Americans’ significant contributions to our nation. https://t.co/mcl8QG9VoL

Tax filing season is now open! April 18 is the deadline to file your taxes. Use the additional few days this year to take extra care to file accurately!

For resources on how to ensure a smooth filing season, visit:  https://t.co/WQfTXweX5f

Every household nationwide can now order 4 free at-home COVID-19 tests delivered to your door by @USPS.  

To order yours, visit https://t.co/uQX3vr2Gtj
We must listen to and remember the stories of survivors, #protectthefacts, and combat Holocaust distortion and denial to prevent any such atrocity from repeating. #NeverAgain

Auschwitz-Birkenau was liberated 77 years ago today. This #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we honor the lives of the 6 million+ Jews, as well as the Roma and Sinti, Slavs, disabled persons, LGBTQ+ individuals, and others killed by Nazis. We also honor those who survived.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is making broadband more affordable AND more accessible.  

The Affordable Connectivity Program (formerly the Emergency Broadband Benefit) will help eligible households afford internet.  

Visit: https://t.co/lloTeyDxlv. https://t.co/xc6uwsvTII

Individuals with private health insurance can now receive 8 free at-home COVID-19 tests per month, thanks to the Biden-Harris administration.  

Learn how: https://t.co/zoAb80KZuZ
Every household can now sign up to receive 4 FREE at-home COVID-19 tests at https://t.co/l52OX5uRkX.

The fight for #votingrights must continue as we face the biggest threat to democracy since the Jim Crow era. We must meet this moment with action – that means sending the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act to President Biden’s desk.
I'm joining @JudyWoodruff and @DukeinDC at 11AM today to discuss my career in Congress. Register here: https://t.co/LDan156919

This #MLKDay, as we reflect on the legacy of Dr. King, let us read and teach our history honestly, use our politics to right enduring wrongs, and chart a just and inclusive path forward. 

I joined the Franklin County Ministerial Alliance virtually for this observance: https://t.co/fMNSQ30OKS

I’m closely following the situation at Congregation Beth Israel in Colleyville, TX, and hope for the safety of those held hostage and law enforcement working for their release. My thoughts are with the community and all those impacted.
Lower your risk for serious infection by masking up and getting boosted. https://t.co/8aF8FdSe18

Improvements to Durham’s public transportation operations will be 🚌 rolling in 🚌 thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law! I spoke with @MayorEONeal about what this historic investment means for @CityofDurhamNC. https://t.co/M4NHU3DrTt

As co-chair of the National Service Caucus, I encourage you to find a way to serve your community this Martin Luther King Jr. Day weekend. You can find virtual & in-person volunteer opportunities at @AmeriCorps website: https://t.co/F3a7YorfLW

Over 1100 of North Carolina’s bridges are in "poor condition"- it's past time we fix it.
 
Thanks to the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw, NC will receive $457 mil. over 5 years to construct, repair, & replace bridges- creating good jobs too! 
https://t.co/8IyDUXC7ga

Republican state legislatures are working tirelessly to curb #votingrights – it threatens our democracy.

I voted today to pass the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act. The Senate must now act swiftly to protect our voting rights.

I joined @DeborahRossNC and @RDUAirport CEO Mike Landguth to discuss how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is paving the way for an extended runway to take the Triangle area to new heights. Watch here: https://t.co/mv95QQcuFw

Congratulations to @FerrelGuillory upon his induction into the Order of the Long Leaf Pine, an award that recognizes his long and distinguished career in journalism, education, and public life! https://t.co/VXHcnZuP8l

Today marks the 20th anniversary of the Guantanamo Bay prison, a day to reflect and renew our commitment to closing this unethical and unjust detention facility. Read the letter to @POTUS that I led in August w/ @RepAdamSchiff and @Ilhan here: https://t.co/vXwfadCk8j

Watch "January 6th: Democracy Under Threat," a discussion about the January 6th insurrection and the state of our democracy with @schanzerdavid, professor of the practice at @DukeSanford.
https://t.co/wwvxAd628r

We are now live on Zoom, use this link to join the discussion until 12:00 p.m. today: https://t.co/CtQJ91gZZT

A recording will be available after the discussion ends if you miss the live conversation. https://t.co/TrJyCuXVDP
Our livestream is delayed due to technical difficulties, stay tuned for more information shortly on how to access the discussion. https://t.co/TrJyCvfwvn

TODAY at 11AM: Watch my Facebook Live with 
@DukeSanford professor @schanzerdavid as we discuss the events of January 6th and the future of our democracy: https://t.co/bPc62Ti9Bu https://t.co/rWWAthu5k2

One year ago today, a pro-Trump mob attacked the Capitol, incited by an unhinged President peddling election lies.

We all must look at the unvarnished truth of that day - it shows democracy is fragile. It's up to us to protect it.

One year ago tomorrow, a violent mob invaded the Capitol, threatening the stability of our democracy. 

How did this happen? Tune into my Democracy Under Attack livestream with @schanzerdavid TOMORROW at 11am. https://t.co/nA50sFvonI https://t.co/ekegQUd8kN

Thursday marks one year since the January 6th insurrection at the Capitol.

I'm hosting a Facebook Live with @schanzerdavid to examine this historic assault on our democracy and where we go from here.

Have questions you'd like answered? ➡️https://t.co/1anY2vPDz5 https://t.co/VIKNB4HDVl
Merry Christmas! Wishing you a safe, joyous holiday season. https://t.co/xAvvk1PQ2j
He was a master legislator and a mentor to many in the arts of politics. North Carolina is much in his debt, and we will miss him. 3/3

George was already going strong in NC politics when we came here with our young family, and I valued his encouragement and counsel as I got increasingly involved and eventually became a fellow-representative of his beloved Durham. 2/3
Lisa and I are saddened to learn of George Miller’s death and extend our condolences to Eula, George and Kate, and others in their circle of family and friends. 1/3

All aboard! 🚂 The Raleigh-to-Richmond rail route along the S-Line could soon be on track for development thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.

I joined Wake County Commissioner Chair @SigHutchinson in Wake Forest to talk about plans for this exciting project. https://t.co/0sfrnQqHFl
Great news! @RDUAirport will receive $14.7 million in federal funds from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, helping to connect our region to the world. https://t.co/jjvFQUlS5p
.@HouseDemocrats and @POTUS are committed to mitigating the impacts of climate change. The #BuildBackBetterAct will cut pollution, reduce energy costs, and create good paying jobs.
The NC HOPE Program application period will close this Friday, Dec. 17. If you are struggling with paying rent or utility bills as a result of the pandemic, visit https://t.co/pjJsDaz8Rb now.

Yesterday, the United States marked an awful milestone: 800,000 lives lost to COVID-19. I extend my deepest condolences to all affected families and communities, and I urge anyone that is not currently vaccinated to do so immediately. 

Help us save lives and end this pandemic.
No American should have to break the bank to afford medicine, which is why the #BuildBackBetterAct allows Medicare to negotiate for lower prescription drug prices.

Today is the last day of the monthly Child Tax Credit payments. Do you think the Child Tax Credit should be extended? 

Take my survey: https://t.co/ZqKUC0Fu2u https://t.co/1b2IfFHs6a

The full faith and credit of the United States should never be put at risk, but Republicans insist on using the US economy as a bargaining chip in their games.  

I voted today to raise the debt ceiling, ensuring that we pay our bills and meet our obligations.

It's hard to fathom -- nine years have passed since 20 children & 6 teachers were murdered at Sandy Hook Elementary. 

Congress has failed to meet the calls for action to end this gun violence epidemic. We must honor their legacies by enacting life-saving reforms NOW.

Congratulations to Pittsboro's new mayor, Cindy Perry! 

As you return for another term as mayor, I look forward to working with you to bring solutions to issues in the Pittsboro community.

Reminder: December 15th is the last day for you to shop, compare, and enroll in an #ACA plan for the coming year.  

Health insurance may be more affordable than you think. Learn more about insurance options for you and your family by visiting https://t.co/CdsQ29yP7t.

Give the gift of protecting yourself, family, and loved ones this holiday season by getting your #COVID19 booster shot. 

Learn more about eligibility and find your shot here: https://t.co/QfxBxxSYyR

Gun violence research deserves federal investment, which is why my colleagues and I are pushing to double the resources for @CDCgov & @NIH for FY22 to $50M. 
Read more on how it will help #EndGunViolence: https://t.co/PHfvDIhDcV

President Trump invited interference in our elections and abused his power – we can't let it happen again. 

I voted for the Protecting Our Democracy Act to give Congress the tools to prevent presidential abuse of power while increasing accountability and transparency.

Congratulations to Carrboro's new mayor, @damonseils! 

After working with Mayor Seils for many years while he was a town council member, I’m excited to continue working together to keep Carrboro moving forward.

Congratulations, Jessica Day, on being sworn in today as the first elected Black female mayor of Knightdale! 

Knightdale is one of North Carolina’s fastest growing municipalities, and I look forward to working with you to keep making it a great place to live, work, and play.

It’s a historic day as @elainefordurham is sworn-in as the new Mayor of Durham – the city’s first Black female mayor! 

Congratulations, Mayor O’Neal, and I look forward to working with you to unite Durham together.

North Carolinians deserve fair maps. 

See the statement from the NC Democratic Congressional Delegation on today's NC Court of Appeals decision to delay candidate filing for the 2022 congressional election: https://t.co/K4MtKNnvbl

We need affordable housing in every community, that’s why I’m fighting to pass the #BuildBackBetter bill. 

Hear my recent interview with @WFDD on what’s included in the legislation and why it matters. https://t.co/9rcPjrUjwz

BIG NEWS: NC is getting $200 million for water infrastructure projects thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure bill! This money will right historic wrongs, replace lead pipes, fix PFAS contamination, & ensure everyone has access to clean water.

Read more: https://t.co/mF9tbupVEl

Republicans are playing a dangerous game by blocking a full year funding bill. While @HouseDemocrats will vote to keep the government open, a stopgap measure isn't enough. 

Here's why: https://t.co/b3ZGTBhQlk

.@HouseGOP leadership is PRO government shutdown. 

@HouseDemocrats want to keep the government open. Simple as that.

Today, I introduced a bipartisan resolution with @RepPfluger expressing support for Moldova’s democracy, independence, and territorial integrity and for strengthening U.S.-Moldova relations.

Learn more: https://t.co/yNhrqLSKDu

On #WorldAidsDay, we remember the lives we have lost and support those currently living with HIV/AIDS. 

Let's recommit to fighting stigma, funding research, and expanding access to high-quality health care as we work to end the epidemic.

Abortion rights are under threat. Today, #SCOTUS hears arguments in a case that could upend Roe v. Wade. It's essential for the Senate to pass the Women's Health Protection Act, ensuring abortion remains safe and legal for all.
Watch live at 10:30 am ET ⤵️ https://t.co/as5PcVHdWt

Tomorrow, I’m excited to chair a @house_democracy virtual hearing with @VernBuchanan on legislative strengthening. Witnesses include Secretary @Madeleine Albright and Ambassador Paula Dobriansky.

Join us at 10:30 am ET: https://t.co/BdMO95TzEZ

#SmallBussinessSaturday is a great time to support your local restaurants and shops. Throughout this pandemic, small businesses were hit hard, but thanks to the American Rescue Plan, we were able to provide the funding to keep these businesses open and serving their communities.

Wishing everyone a happy & safe Thanksgiving. Wherever you may gather, let us all be thankful that this year we can do so safely thanks to the wide availability & effectiveness of COVID-19 vaccines.  

With FDA approval of booster shots, find yours: https://t.co/I6vgJYAlTW

The House-passed #BuildBackBetterAct includes $30B for the creation of a Civilian Climate Corps. As chair of the National Service Caucus, I’m pleased to see $15.2B of this funding go toward creating up to 300,000 new @AmeriCorps positions focusing on environmental stewardship.

Happy to see the first round of Child Care Stabilization grants go live for qualified providers. Glad @NC_Governor is using #ARP funds to provide this critical relief for North Carolina families and grow our state's economy!

Happy to announce that a team of students from @NCSSM have won the 2021 Congressional App challenge for the 4th District with their app “SL Translate,” an app which helps people use American Sign Language to communicate through a written transcript! https://t.co/oFFkxVIszj https://t.co/qJ2jr2QmOs
Everyone ages 5 and up is now eligible to get their COVID-19 vaccine. Find your shot: https://t.co/I6vgJYiL2o

@GOPleader tried to stand in the way of progress, but instead embarrassed himself on the House floor for 8 hours. 

Meanwhile, @HouseDemocrats stayed the course and passed #BuildBackBetterAct to make life-changing investments in the people who make this country what it is.
This legislation is representative of @HouseDemocrats commitment to the success of families. Alongside the BIF, these bills will provide a road map to a more equitable and sustainable future.

The Build Back Better Act has passed the House!

This critical legislation would not just tinker around the edges-- it makes generational investments in everything from affordable housing to Child Care, ensuring a strong economy for years to come.

In 1970, James Cates was murdered by white supremacists outside of @UNC's student union. Our collective healing must honor his legacy while reckoning with this violence.  

Learn about the community commemoration of James Cates tonight at 7pm w/ @chpublib: https://t.co/9a1bK8vNNt
Here is my personal statement on the retirement of my friend, @GKButterfield: https://t.co/yINSJAvb0S
ICYMI: Last week, I held my annual Veterans’ Briefing and heard from an incredible panel of local, state, and national veterans experts! Watch here: https://t.co/3d2g3lIajn

As @AppropsDems T-HUD Chair, I am thrilled that the @CityofDurhamNC has been awarded a $9M @USDOT RAISE grant for the Durham Belt Line, a multi-use trail to increase mobility, livability, and economic competitiveness in Durham and the region.

#NC04 continues to lead the way in the fight against COVID-19!  Check out how @UNC and @DukeU scientists found a new antibody to help combat the virus with the help of federal funds.  
https://t.co/67n41HzixK

Excited to be back to Washington to pass the #BuildBackBetterAct, delivering @POTUS agenda for the American people. This package contains generational investments in housing, child care, and climate action that our country needs now.

Excited to be at the White House for this monumental day, joining @POTUS as he signs the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act into law! This historic investment is essential to repair our crumbling infrastructure, bolster our economy, and provide good-paying jobs. https://t.co/GQtnBKLAku

Today is the LAST day to claim your #ChildTaxCredit! The expanded #ChildTaxCredit has delivered $37.1 million dollars to eligible families throughout #NC04. Join your fellow North Carolinians and sign up for a 2021 payment today at https://t.co/pQudchzuV5

Nearly 400,000 North Carolinians lack reliable internet access. With the #BIF signed into law, $65 billion will go towards building out a robust broadband network and connecting everyone, regardless of zip code.

This #VeteransDay, I remain committed to fighting alongside @HouseDems & @AppropsDems to end veteran homelessness and increase funds for mental health resources and suicide prevention outreach. https://t.co/gtEhu1uqkf

Excited to be joined by @FLONC at my annual Veteran’s Briefing today to recognize and support the veteran community in #NC04.  

Join us now: https://t.co/u662Tx7Zmw https://t.co/6pEY9Bgm0K

Excited to be joined by @FLONC at my annual Veteran’s Briefing tomorrow! 

Register to join us: https://t.co/u662Tx7Zmw https://t.co/YucawiblzK
My Statement on the Passing of Harvey Montague. https://t.co/g6nsdM71eG

It is finally Infrastructure Week! Happy to join @RepDeborahRoss @NCDOT Secretary Boyette, Commissioner @SigHutchinson, Council Member Corey Branch, @MSVMayorTJ at @RalUnionStation today to share more about this once-in-a-generation investment’s impact on North Carolina. https://t.co/wcBtpJ9g2f

Last night, I voted to pass the #BIF. This generational investment will create good paying jobs, fix our crumbling infrastructure, make bold investments in clean water, and expand broadband access – ensuring America’s competitiveness for years to come.
Getting vaccinated against COVID-19 and the flu will help protect you and your community. Step up to the plate and take your shot!

Earlier this year, Democrats came together and passed the #AmericanRescuePlan to save our economy. October's unemployment rate was 4.6% -- a pandemic-era low. We have the chance to continue this growth by passing the #BuildBackBetterAct and #BIF tonight.
November is National Native American Heritage Month-- time for us to celebrate and uplift the rich culture and history of Native Americans throughout this country. https://t.co/LAGAVFAmqo

#COVID19 vaccines have been approved for children ages 5-11, a tremendous step forward in the effort to slow the spread of the virus and keep our children safe. Happy to see @NC_Governor in the 4th District today as we continue to get shots in arms. https://t.co/sLRD6kP6ZM
Happy Diwali to all who are celebrating!

Join me virtually on November 10th at 10am for my Annual Veterans’ Briefing! You’ll hear from local, state, and national experts, and will learn more about resources available to veterans! 

RSVP: https://t.co/u662Tx7Zmw

Unaccompanied migrant children are some of the most vulnerable individuals in our care. They deserve to be housed safely and treated with dignity.
